intro: Polycarpon gmelinii, commonly known as the small evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its yellow, four-petaled flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It has slender, branched stems and linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across various regions.
